aou_req__communication__1.content:
It shall be ensured that enough memory is configured for shared memory instances,
in order that LoLa can perform all necessary allocations (e.g. push-back on a Vector).
aou_req__communication__1.title: Monotonic Semi-Dynamic Memory Allocation

aou_req__communication__10.content:
It shall be ensured that any configuration item that is read at runtime by LoLa is
stored on a safety certified filesystem (according to the highest supported safety level).
aou_req__communication__10.title: Config on a safe filesystem

aou_req__communication__11.content: It shall be ensured that LoLa is not used within static context within C++.
aou_req__communication__11.title: No static context support

aou_req__communication__12.content: It shall be ensured that no safety goal is harmed, because a service instance is not found.
aou_req__communication__12.title: No guarantee in availability of services

aou_req__communication__13.content:
It shall be ensure that termination (either gracefully or due to a malfunction)
of a producer will not lead to a violation of a safety goal.
aou_req__communication__13.title: No notification on termination of producer

aou_req__communication__14.content:
It shall be checked if Allocate() on an event will return a nullptr. If a nullptr is returned,
the system shall transition to safe state.
aou_req__communication__14.title: Check for nullptr on Allocate()

aou_req__communication__15.content: It shall be ensured that at any time a producer instance per event only holds one AllocateePtr.
aou_req__communication__15.title: One producer only one AllocateePtr

aou_req__communication__16.content: It shall be ensured that Send(const& value) is not invoked while an AllocateePtr is held.
aou_req__communication__16.title: No Copy-Send() while holding AllocateePtr.

aou_req__communication__17.content:
It shall be ensured that any LoLa API that is bound to a specific event
 instance is not called in a reentrant manner.
aou_req__communication__17.title: None reentrant methods per event instance

aou_req__communication__18.content: It shall be ensured that a Skeleton instance is still alive while any AllocateePtr returned by it is used.
aou_req__communication__18.title: Skeleton alive while its AllocateePtr being used

aou_req__communication__19.content:
It shall be ensured that Unsubscribe() isn't called on a proxy eventinstance as long as
any SamplePtr provided by it, is still held.
aou_req__communication__19.title: Event Subscription active while holding SamplePtr

aou_req__communication__2.content:
It shall be ensured that correct maximum number of subscriber is configured for each
event for each service instance.
aou_req__communication__2.title: Correctly Configured Maximum Number of Subscribers

aou_req__communication__20.content: It shall be ensured that any callback passed to LoLa for invocation is not throwing.
aou_req__communication__20.title: Non-Terminating callbacks

aou_req__communication__21.content: It shall be ensured that all callbacks passed towards LoLa are valid as long as the associated proxy is alive.
aou_req__communication__21.title: Valid callbacks while proxy alive

aou_req__communication__22.content: It shall be ensured that the necessary quality of data is produced by the respective skeleton process.
aou_req__communication__22.title: Quality of data is dependent on producer

aou_req__communication__23.content:
It shall be ensured that no pointer, pointing to the memory of a SamplePtr
or AllocateePtr is used once the SamplePtr or AllocateePtr are invalid.
aou_req__communication__23.title: Validity of pointer on LoLa pointer

aou_req__communication__24.content: It shall be ensured that no other code accesses the mapped memory managed by LoLa.
aou_req__communication__24.title: LoLa Memory only accessed through LoLa

aou_req__communication__25.content: It shall be ensured that no other code creates shared memory segments beginning with "lola".
aou_req__communication__25.title: No shared memory allocation in namespace lola

aou_req__communication__26.content: It shall be ensured that the LoLa specific QNX Message Passing end-points are only accessed through LoLa APIs.
aou_req__communication__26.title: LoLa specific QNX Messaging End-Points only accessed through LoLa

aou_req__communication__27.content:
If aragen is being used to generate LoLa interfaces, any output produced by aragen
shall be manually reviewed for its correctness.
aou_req__communication__27.title: aragen not safe

aou_req__communication__28.content: It shall be ensured that neither variants nor maps are sent via LoLa.
aou_req__communication__28.title: unsupported data-types

aou_req__communication__29.content: There is no guarantee on the execution time of any function call provided by LoLa.
aou_req__communication__29.title: No guarantee on execution time

aou_req__communication__3.content:
It shall be ensured that correct maximum number of elements per subscriber is
 configured for each event for each service instance.
aou_req__communication__3.title: Correctly configured maximum number of maximum elements per subscriber

aou_req__communication__30.content:
If event instance "oversubscription" is enabled. LoLa makes no warranty, that proxies/consumers
can't suffer from data loss! It is the responsibility of the user to adapt scheduling/event-data
access in a way, that no data-loss happens.
However, we can give the guarantee that if only QM consumers misbehave,ASIL consumers are not
affected by these actions.
aou_req__communication__30.title: Usage of configuration "oversubscription"

aou_req__communication__31.content:
All compiler settings having influence on the binary representation of data exchanged via
mw::com/LoLa (event, field, service-method payloads) have to be identical for compilation of
code containing mw::com proxies and skeletons, which communicate.
aou_req__communication__31.title: Same compiler settings for provider and consumer side

aou_req__communication__32.content:
When receiving event or field data via untyped GenericProxyEvent or GenericProxyField, care has to
be taken, when accessing the corresponding SamplePtr<void> delivered by calls to GetNewSamples():
When casting it to the expected type, it needs to be checked, that no access behind the size returned
by GetSampleSize() will happen.
aou_req__communication__32.title: Event or Field reception via GenericProxy needs specific care

aou_req__communication__34.content:
It shall be ensured that all safety relevant events/fields in the service type,
are the same in all configurations.
aou_req__communication__34.title: Correctly configured events/fields per service type

aou_req__communication__4.content:
The ASIL-Level is used to ensure Freedom from Interference (e.g. by configuring access rights).
 Without a proper configured level, this cannot be ensured.
aou_req__communication__4.title: Correctly configured ASIL Level

aou_req__communication__5.content: It shall be ensured, that only types that are supported by LoLa are transmitted.
aou_req__communication__5.title: Only LoLa supported types

aou_req__communication__6.content:
It shall be ensured that no API calls from the implementation namespace (e.g `impl`)
are directly invoked or types from within are directly used.
aou_req__communication__6.title: No APIs from Implementation Namespace

aou_req__communication__7.content: It shall be ensured that a miss behavior of event notification, will not harm a safety goal.
aou_req__communication__7.title: No guarantees for notifications

aou_req__communication__8.content:
It shall be ensured that a message overflow, which results in message loss will not harm a safety goal.
If this is not possible, a check for message overflow and necessary actions need to be performed.
aou_req__communication__8.title: Checking for possible message overflow

aou_req__communication__9.content: It shall be ensured that processes with a different ASIL shall be executed within different user-ids.
aou_req__communication__9.title: Different user for ASIL and QM processes
