stkh_req__ai_platform__enablement.content: The SW-platform shall support the execution of traditional ML workloads on-board.
stkh_req__ai_platform__enablement.rationale: Modern vehicles require the integration of ML capabilities to remain competitive and support customer expectations.
stkh_req__ai_platform__enablement.title: On-board ML Workloads

stkh_req__ai_platform__model_security.content: The SW-platform shall ensure secure, verified, and integrity-checked model execution.
stkh_req__ai_platform__model_security.rationale: AI model execution must be protected against tampering or abuse.
stkh_req__ai_platform__model_security.title: Secure Model Execution

stkh_req__ai_platform__platform_portabil.content: The SW-platform shall support both QNX (for safety) and Linux (for GenAI and flexibility) with reusable components.
stkh_req__ai_platform__platform_portabil.rationale: AI/ML use cases span both safety and non-safety environments, requiring portability across operating systems.
stkh_req__ai_platform__platform_portabil.title: Platform Portability (QNX + Linux)

stkh_req__ai_platform__runtime_determini.content: The SW-platform shall ensure deterministic behavior for AI components used in safety-relevant paths.
stkh_req__ai_platform__runtime_determini.rationale: Safety certification requires predictable and bounded system behavior.
stkh_req__ai_platform__runtime_determini.title: Deterministic Execution Paths

stkh_req__ai_platform__runtime_efficienc.content: The SW-platform shall be optimized for runtime performance and memory footprint on embedded hardware targets.
stkh_req__ai_platform__runtime_efficienc.rationale: Automotive platforms have limited compute and thermal budgets.
stkh_req__ai_platform__runtime_efficienc.title: Runtime Efficiency for Edge Devices

stkh_req__ai_platform__safety_critical.content: The SW-platform shall support safety-compliant (ASIL-B) deployment of AI/ML components, including inference backends and pipelines.
stkh_req__ai_platform__safety_critical.rationale: Some ML-based functionality is required to be certified up to ASIL-B.
stkh_req__ai_platform__safety_critical.title: Support for Safety-Critical ML

stkh_req__app_architectures__support_dat.content: The SW-platform shall support an event-driven, high-throughput application architecture where execution is triggered by data changes.
stkh_req__app_architectures__support_dat.title: Support for Data-driven Architecture

stkh_req__app_architectures__support_req.content: The SW-platform shall support a request-driven, asynchronous application architecture that processes requests on-demand.
stkh_req__app_architectures__support_req.title: Support for Request-driven Architecture

stkh_req__app_architectures__support_tim.content:
The SW-platform shall support a deterministic, time-based application execution model that triggers logic based on predefined schedules or
polling intervals.
stkh_req__app_architectures__support_tim.title: Support for Time-based Architectures

stkh_req__communication__abi_compatible.content: The SW-platform shall support ABI compatible data types for zero-copy communication between Rust and C++ applications.
stkh_req__communication__abi_compatible.rationale: ABI compatiblity ensures that the same memory location is correctly interpreted by different programming languages.
stkh_req__communication__abi_compatible.title: ABI Compatible Data Types

stkh_req__communication__auto_diagnostic.content:
The SW-platform shall support the following diagnostic protocols
* SOVD (ISO 17978)
* UDS (ISO 14229) Diagnostics
* Diagnostic trouble codes
* Diagnostic jobs
stkh_req__communication__auto_diagnostic.title: Automotive diagnostics

stkh_req__communication__extensible_exte.content: The SW-platform shall support external communication via well established protocols e.g. Zenoh, DDS.
stkh_req__communication__extensible_exte.rationale: ECUs need to interact with each other. There are multiple protocols today and more to come in the future.
stkh_req__communication__extensible_exte.title: Extensible External Communication

stkh_req__communication__inter_process.content: The SW-platform shall support inter-process communication.
stkh_req__communication__inter_process.rationale: Application software typically consists of multiple processes which need to interact.
stkh_req__communication__inter_process.title: Inter-process Communication

stkh_req__communication__intra_process.content: The SW-platform shall support intra-process communication.
stkh_req__communication__intra_process.rationale: Application software typically maps software building blocks into the same process.
stkh_req__communication__intra_process.title: Intra-process Communication

stkh_req__communication__safe.content:
The SW-platform shall support safe communication.

Note: This is part of 0.5 release and therefore can only support ASIL_B. Goal is ASIL_D.
stkh_req__communication__safe.rationale: Distributed safe systems often require communication to be safe.
stkh_req__communication__safe.title: Safe Communication

stkh_req__communication__secure.content: The SW-platform shall support secure communication.
stkh_req__communication__secure.rationale: Distributed secure systems often require secure communication.
stkh_req__communication__secure.title: Secure Communication

stkh_req__communication__service_quality.content:
The SW-platform shall provide a framework to ensure quality of service
of applications deployed on the SW-platform. This includes but is not limited
to:

* QOS for applications
* Controlled latency for communication and scheduling
* Guaranteed network and compute quotas
stkh_req__communication__service_quality.title: Quality of service

stkh_req__communication__stable_app_inte.content:
The SW-platform shall provide a framework to mitigate incompatible changes on
external interfaces to keep application interfaces stable.
stkh_req__communication__stable_app_inte.rationale: In case of incompatible changes on external interface the portability effort shall be reduced.
stkh_req__communication__stable_app_inte.title: Stable application interfaces

stkh_req__communication__supported_net.content:
The SW-platform shall support the following automotive network
protocols

* SOME/IP
* DDS
* UWB including Driver for UWB Peripheral
* SPI (+ CSC ADI & Texas Instruments chipset support)
* Vehicle to Grid + ISO Charge protocols
* AVB
stkh_req__communication__supported_net.title: Supported network protocols

stkh_req__dependability__automotive_safe.content:
The SW-platform shall support applications with an automotive safety
integrity level up to ASIL-B.

Note: This is part of 0.5 release and therefore can only support ASIL_B. Goal is ASIL_D.
stkh_req__dependability__automotive_safe.rationale: The SW-platform shall be usable by safety relevant applications.
stkh_req__dependability__automotive_safe.title: Automotive Safety Integrity Level

stkh_req__dependability__availability.content:
The SW-platform shall support the development of highly available systems.
(see also `Availability <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Availability>`_).
stkh_req__dependability__availability.title: Availability

stkh_req__dependability__safety_features.content:
The SW-platform shall support the following safety feature:

* Health Management (alive, deadline, logical supervision) for time and event based taskchains
* E2E Protection for communication
* Built-in hardware self-tests
* Safe reset paths
* IO MMU protecting DMA accesses
* Memory Management Unit
* Memory Protection Unit for caches
* ECC Memory
* Software Lockstep
* Power management integrated circuit (PMIC), external watchdog and voltage monitoring
* Safe switch from engineering for field mode and back

Note: This is part of 0.5 release and therefore can only support ASIL_B. Goal is ASIL_D.
stkh_req__dependability__safety_features.title: Safety features

stkh_req__dependability__security_featur.content:
The SW-platform shall support the following security features:

* Mandatory access control
* Secure boot
* Secure onboard communication
* IPSec and MACSec
* Firewall
* Certificate installation and storage in HSM or ARM trustzone.
* Kernel hardening (ASLR, Pointer obfuscation …) in libc and compiler
* Identity and Access Management
* Secure Feature Activation
* Secure software update
stkh_req__dependability__security_featur.title: Security features

stkh_req__dev_experience__boot_logging.content:
The SW-platform shall support logging of data to memory which survives a reboot
cycle.
stkh_req__dev_experience__boot_logging.title: Previous boot logging

stkh_req__dev_experience__debugging.content:
The SW-platform shall provide a method and interface to enable
debugging of the software on target and in vehicle.
stkh_req__dev_experience__debugging.title: Debugging

stkh_req__dev_experience__dev_toolchain.content:
The SW-platform shall support a state-of-the art developer experience for
functional development and application development.

Features:

* IDE support for all supported languages.
* IDL Editor with syntax highlighting.
* Connection to qemu and real target via SSH.
* Support of continuous integration and deployment systems.
stkh_req__dev_experience__dev_toolchain.title: Developer experience and development toolchain

stkh_req__dev_experience__idl_support.content:
The SW-platform shall provide a human readable interface definition language
with decentralized glue code generation.
stkh_req__dev_experience__idl_support.title: IDL Support

stkh_req__dev_experience__logging_suppor.content:
The SW-platform shall support the following logging setups:

* Logging to external disk via mounted filesystem on top of PCIe driver
* Logging via second dedicated Ethernet Channel
* Logging/sensor data Gathering via Cloud native filesystem on top of second Ethernet Channel
* Gathering of raw sensor data e.g. video streams
* Diagnostic Log and Trace / Logcat format is supported
* Logging of early startup events
stkh_req__dev_experience__logging_suppor.title: Logging support

stkh_req__dev_experience__mockup_public_.content:
The SW-platform shall provide support for mocking its public interfaces,
enabling unit, component and integration testing of applications.
stkh_req__dev_experience__mockup_public_.rationale: Enables unit, component and integration testing for both SW-platform related and non-platform related applications.
stkh_req__dev_experience__mockup_public_.title: Mockup implementation for application testing

stkh_req__dev_experience__perf_analysis.content:
The SW-platform shall support performance analysis of SW-platform and
application software:

* Flame-graph visualization for long termed CPU behavior
* RAM usage statistics for long-term Memory behavior
stkh_req__dev_experience__perf_analysis.title: Performance analysis

stkh_req__dev_experience__prog_languages.content:
The SW-platform shall support implementation of applications in the following
programming languages up to the highest ASIL level as defined in :need:`stkh_req__dependability__automotive_safety`:

* C
* C++
* Rust
stkh_req__dev_experience__prog_languages.title: Programming languages for application development

stkh_req__dev_experience__reprocessing.content: The SW-platform shall support data-collection and injection of reprocessed data.
stkh_req__dev_experience__reprocessing.title: Reprocessing and simulation support

stkh_req__dev_experience__timing_analysi.content:
The SW-platform shall support observation, assessment of
timing requirements with state-of-the-art analysis tools.
stkh_req__dev_experience__timing_analysi.title: Timing analysis

stkh_req__dev_experience__tracing_of_com.content:
The SW-platform shall support the tracing of communication events for internal
and external communication systems.
stkh_req__dev_experience__tracing_of_com.title: Tracing of communication

stkh_req__dev_experience__tracing_of_exe.content:
The SW-platform shall support the tracing of events (start, stop) of executable
entities and kernel threads on all computation units e.g.

* CPU
* GPU
* Neural Network Processors
* Image Processors
* etc.
stkh_req__dev_experience__tracing_of_exe.title: Tracing of execution

stkh_req__dev_experience__tracing_of_mem.content:
The SW-platform shall support the tracing of memory events (allocation, copy,
de-allocation) for different types of memory e.g.

* CPU Memory
* GPU Memory
stkh_req__dev_experience__tracing_of_mem.title: Tracing of memory access

stkh_req__diagnostics__custom_services.content: The SW-platform shall support extensibility mechanisms that allow integration of custom diagnostic services and routines via the SOVD interface.
stkh_req__diagnostics__custom_services.rationale: Enables OEMs and developers to implement system-specific or project-specific routines for diagnostic control and testing.
stkh_req__diagnostics__custom_services.title: Extensibility of Diagnostic Services

stkh_req__diagnostics__distributed_suppo.content: The SW-platform shall support distributed diagnostics across multiple ECUs and network segments, enabling routing and aggregation of diagnostic data.
stkh_req__diagnostics__distributed_suppo.rationale: Enables the system to operate in modern, distributed vehicle architectures where diagnostics span multiple ECUs and subsystems.
stkh_req__diagnostics__distributed_suppo.title: Support for Distributed and Multi-ECU Diagnostics

stkh_req__diagnostics__dtc_read_sovd.content: The SW-platform shall provide users the ability to retrieve current Diagnostic Trouble Codes (DTCs) from the ECU via the SOVD protocol.
stkh_req__diagnostics__dtc_read_sovd.rationale: Enables reading of Diagnostic Trouble Codes (DTCs) from the ECU for various use-cases like production or maintenance.
stkh_req__diagnostics__dtc_read_sovd.title: Readout DTCs via SOVD

stkh_req__diagnostics__fault_reporting.content: The SW-platform shall support a reusable fault reporting infrastructure that enables applications and SW-platform components to report, persist, and manage diagnostic fault information.
stkh_req__diagnostics__fault_reporting.rationale: Enables applications and components to report faults in a structured, reusable, and system-wide accessible manner.
stkh_req__diagnostics__fault_reporting.title: Fault Reporting Infrastructure

stkh_req__diagnostics__secure_access.content: The SW-platform shall enforce secure access control for all diagnostic interfaces, including authentication, encryption, and role-based access enforcement.
stkh_req__diagnostics__secure_access.rationale: Diagnostic access allows deep system introspection and manipulation, which must be protected against unauthorized use.
stkh_req__diagnostics__secure_access.title: Secure Access to Diagnostic Interfaces

stkh_req__diagnostics__uds_ecus.content: The SW-platform shall support integration with ECUs that use UDS by providing a compatibility adapter to translate SOVD requests to UDS commands.
stkh_req__diagnostics__uds_ecus.rationale: Ensures continued operability of ECUs that are not SOVD-capable.
stkh_req__diagnostics__uds_ecus.title: Compatibility with UDS ECUs

stkh_req__diagnostics__uds_tester_compat.content: The SW-platform shall provide compatibility with UDS-based testers by offering a proxy to translate UDS requests into SOVD-compatible actions.
stkh_req__diagnostics__uds_tester_compat.rationale: Ensures continued usability of existing test infrastructure, avoiding costly replacement of legacy tools and ensuring fulfillment of legal requirements.
stkh_req__diagnostics__uds_tester_compat.title: Compatibility with UDS Testers

stkh_req__diagnostics__via_sovd.content: The SW-platform shall support vehicle diagnostics via the SOVD protocol as defined in ISO 17978, to allow scalable and secure diagnostic access.
stkh_req__diagnostics__via_sovd.rationale: Enables modern, scalable diagnostics using a standard REST-based protocol to improve integration, interoperability, and maintainability.
stkh_req__diagnostics__via_sovd.title: Diagnostic via SOVD

stkh_req__example_feature__archdes_examp.content: The platform shall provide the feature ....
stkh_req__example_feature__archdes_examp.title: Example Stkh Req

stkh_req__execution_model__low_power.content: The SW-platform shall support low power modes to safe energy.
stkh_req__execution_model__low_power.title: Low power mode

stkh_req__execution_model__processes.content:
The SW-platform shall support the following scheduling strategies:

* Process Management

  * Startup and Shutdown of processes
  * Recovery
  * Machine State Management (modelled via simple JSON file)

* Cross-process synchronization of threads (Activities)

  * Event activated multi-process taskchains
  * Time-sliced activated multi-process taskchains
  * memory management (via PMR),
  * signal handling, error handling (FPU Exceptions, other traps …)
stkh_req__execution_model__processes.title: Processes and thread management

stkh_req__execution_model__realtime_cap.content:
The SW-platform shall support the controlled reaction on events
(timing events, interrupts) within a defined timing interval.
stkh_req__execution_model__realtime_cap.title: Realtime capabilities

stkh_req__execution_model__short_app_cyc.content:
The SW-platform shall support cycle times of less then 5 ms on application level
if this is supported by the underlying hardware.
stkh_req__execution_model__short_app_cyc.title: Short application cycles

stkh_req__execution_model__startup_perf.content:
The SW-platform shall support fast startup scenarios e.g. cold boot and
resume from hibernate mode.
stkh_req__execution_model__startup_perf.title: Startup performance

stkh_req__functiona_req__support_of_stor.content:
The SW-platform shall provide towards the applications a safe key/value store.

Note: This is part of 0.5 release and therefore can only support ASIL_B. Goal is ASIL_D.
stkh_req__functiona_req__support_of_stor.rationale: Key/Value storage is a standard way to structure file based non-volatile memory access.
stkh_req__functiona_req__support_of_stor.title: Support of safe Key/Value store

stkh_req__functional_req__base_libraries.content: The SW-platform shall provide a set of base libraries offering common functionality for SW-platform components.
stkh_req__functional_req__base_libraries.rationale: Common libraries reduce duplication, improve consistency and quality across components.
stkh_req__functional_req__base_libraries.title: Base Libraries

stkh_req__functional_req__comm_with_cont.content:
The SW-platform shall define protocols and concepts for the interaction with
external micro-controllers for

* board management
* external supervision for safety and security functions
* software update
* debugging
* feature activation
stkh_req__functional_req__comm_with_cont.title: Communication with external MCUs/standby controllers

stkh_req__functional_req__comp_subsystem.content:
The SW-platform shall provide the following frameworks towards the
applications:

* Math library: Eigen Blaze like safety enhanced math front-end library
* Graphics and compute API: Vulkan GPU back-end and CPU (SIMD capable)-based compute libraries:

  * Deep Neural Network API:  (including pytorch, tensorflow conversion scripts)
  * Computer Vision API: e.g. like OpenCV
  * Linear algebra API: e.g. BLAS / Lapack
  * AVB Sensor streams
  * PCIe Sensor streams
  * Shared Memory Sensor streams
  * GSML serialized data
stkh_req__functional_req__comp_subsystem.title: Compute subsystem

stkh_req__functional_req__data_persisten.content: The SW-platform shall support to store data on non-volatile memory e.g. disks, flash, etc.
stkh_req__functional_req__data_persisten.rationale: Applications typically need to store data across power cycles.
stkh_req__functional_req__data_persisten.title: Data Persistency

stkh_req__functional_req__file_based.content: The SW-platform shall support configuration of applications via files (e.g. yaml, json)
stkh_req__functional_req__file_based.rationale: File based configuration allows changes without rebuilding the software.
stkh_req__functional_req__file_based.title: File Based Configuration

stkh_req__functional_req__hardware_compu.content: The SW-platform shall support computation accelerated by a Hardware accelerator.
stkh_req__functional_req__hardware_compu.rationale: High computation loads typically need to be speed up hardware acceleration e.g. in ADAS applications
stkh_req__functional_req__hardware_compu.title: Hardware Accelerated Computation

stkh_req__functional_req__operating_syst.content: The SW-platform shall support operating systems compliant with IEEE Std 1003.1 (2004 Edition or newer)
stkh_req__functional_req__operating_syst.rationale: This allows portability of SW-platform on POSIX compliant operating systems.
stkh_req__functional_req__operating_syst.title: Operating System

stkh_req__functional_req__safe_comput.content:
The SW-platform shall support safe computation.

Note: This is part of 0.5 release and therefore can only support ASIL_B. Goal is ASIL_D.
stkh_req__functional_req__safe_comput.rationale: Safe systems require computations to be done in safe environments.
stkh_req__functional_req__safe_comput.title: Safe Computation

stkh_req__functional_req__safe_config.content:
The SW-platform shall support safe configuration.

Note: This is part of 0.5 release and therefore can only support ASIL_B. Goal is ASIL_D.
stkh_req__functional_req__safe_config.rationale: Configuration files may hold safety relevant information.
stkh_req__functional_req__safe_config.title: Safe Configuration

stkh_req__functional_req__video_subsyste.content:
The SW-platform shall provide an interface for pre-processing and
distribution of camera data via the following mechanisms

* PCIe Graphic streams
* Shared Memory Graphic streams
* Display Serial Interface Driver
* APIX serialization driver
* ISP Driver including correction and frame pre-processing CV library (lens distortion et. al.)
* Sensor Streamer component (binding ISP Driver & pre-processing CV library)
stkh_req__functional_req__video_subsyste.title: Video subsystem

stkh_req__gen_ai__enablement.content: The SW-platform shall support the execution of Generative AI workloads on-board.
stkh_req__gen_ai__enablement.rationale: Modern vehicles require the integration of AI/ML capabilities to remain competitive and support customer expectations.
stkh_req__gen_ai__enablement.title: On-board GenAI Workloads

stkh_req__gen_ai__interaction.content: The SW-platform shall support on-device GenAI-based models with user interaction.
stkh_req__gen_ai__interaction.rationale: HMIs are expected to support intelligent, natural interaction using LLM-based assistants.
stkh_req__gen_ai__interaction.title: GenAI User Interaction

stkh_req__gen_ai__safety_filter.content: The SW-platform shall validate all actions proposed by GenAI models against safety and policy rules prior to execution.
stkh_req__gen_ai__safety_filter.rationale: GenAI output may be unpredictable or unsafe and must be controlled before affecting vehicle behavior.
stkh_req__gen_ai__safety_filter.title: Action Safety and Governance

stkh_req__gen_ai__vehicle_com.content: The SW-platform shall expose structured APIs to access vehicle state and execute safe commands.
stkh_req__gen_ai__vehicle_com.rationale: AI components must interact with vehicle state and control interfaces.
stkh_req__gen_ai__vehicle_com.title: Seamless Integration with Vehicle Systems

stkh_req__hardware_support__chipset_supp.content: The SW-platform shall support arm64 and x64 architectures.
stkh_req__hardware_support__chipset_supp.title: Chipset support for ARM64 and x64

stkh_req__hardware_support__container_te.content:
The SW-platform shall support deployment of self-contained application
bundles

* Kernel Features: e.g. cgroup, secpol, namespaces as precondition for containerization
* e.g. SOAFFEE Like realtime capable containers: https://www.soafee.io/
stkh_req__hardware_support__container_te.title: Support of container technologies

stkh_req__hardware_support__debug_and_te.content:
The SW-platform shall run on qemu to enable test and debug in virtualized
environments.
stkh_req__hardware_support__debug_and_te.title: Virtualization support for debug and testing

stkh_req__integration__multi_repo.content: The SW-platform infrastructure shall support integration of multiple repositories in a unified workflow.
stkh_req__integration__multi_repo.rationale: Allow independent development of software modules
stkh_req__integration__multi_repo.title: Multirepo integration

stkh_req__overall_goals__enable_cooperat.content: The SW-platform shall where possible be based on existing standards (e.g. network protocols).
stkh_req__overall_goals__enable_cooperat.rationale: To enable cooperation with other cooperation partners.
stkh_req__overall_goals__enable_cooperat.title: Enable cooperation via standardized APIs

stkh_req__overall_goals__ip_protection.content:
The SW-platform shall support cooperation models, where partners do not
want to disclose their intellectual property of applications to all other
partners.
stkh_req__overall_goals__ip_protection.title: IP protection

stkh_req__overall_goals__reuse_of_app_so.content:
The SW-platform shall enable the reuse of application software via a set of managed APIs.
These APIs shall be developed via a well-defined life-cycle ensuring
non-breaking changes.
stkh_req__overall_goals__reuse_of_app_so.rationale: This is a usability constraint needed for long maintenance support
stkh_req__overall_goals__reuse_of_app_so.title: Reuse of application software via managed APIs

stkh_req__overall_goals__variant_managem.content:
The SW-platform shall provide variant management support.
Variant management support shall enable users to ensure the
compatibility of application software across vehicle variants and vehicle
software releases.
stkh_req__overall_goals__variant_managem.title: Variant management

stkh_req__quality__assumptions_and_dd.content: Contributors shall specify all assumptions and design decisions as requirements which are agreed within the S-CORE community.
stkh_req__quality__assumptions_and_dd.rationale: This is a usability constraint needed for long term maintenance support
stkh_req__quality__assumptions_and_dd.title: Document assumptions and design decisions

stkh_req__re_requirements__traceability.content: he SW-platform infrastructure shall support linking all requirements from lower to upper level, whereby on the top-level are the stakeholder requirements.
stkh_req__re_requirements__traceability.rationale: This is a usability constraint needed for long term maintenance support
stkh_req__re_requirements__traceability.title: Requirements traceability

stkh_req__requirements__as_code.content: The SW-platform infrastructure shall support documenting all requirements as code (Docs-as-code).
stkh_req__requirements__as_code.rationale: In this project no external tool or service is used. Therefore as-code is the selected option.
stkh_req__requirements__as_code.title: Document requirements as code

stkh_req__requirements__template.rationale: Exists just for the template example
stkh_req__requirements__template.section_name: <Headlines (for the list of requirements if structuring is needed)>
sections: <Headlines (for the list of requirements if structuring is needed)>
stkh_req__requirements__template.title: Template

stkh_req__time__absolute_time_api.content: The SW-platform shall provide access to the absolute time base, synchronized with external time sources.
stkh_req__time__absolute_time_api.rationale: Enables an application to correlate its data with an absolute vehicle-external time reference for event timestamping and chronological events comparison.
stkh_req__time__absolute_time_api.title: Absolute time base API

stkh_req__time__absolute_time_sync.content: The SW-platform shall provide a framework to synchronize the clock to external-to-vehicle absolute time base (UTC).
stkh_req__time__absolute_time_sync.rationale: Enables the system to validate a certificate or token with temporal validity conditions, adding a UTC-timestamp to a data set.
stkh_req__time__absolute_time_sync.title: Time Synchronization with external sources

stkh_req__time__high_precision_clock_api.content:
The SW-platform shall provide access to the current high precision clock from the system time provider in nanoseconds.

Note: to which clock the high precision clock is mapped, depends on the system design.
stkh_req__time__high_precision_clock_api.rationale: Enables an application to get the current system time, which is essential for time-sensitive operations and event scheduling, via common, mockable and standardized API.
stkh_req__time__high_precision_clock_api.title: Local High precision Clock API

stkh_req__time__hw_clock_sync.content: The SW-platform shall synchronize the local HW clock to vehicle time.
stkh_req__time__hw_clock_sync.rationale: Enables the system to compare events from different ECUs chronologically, using the same time base for timestamping ingress and egress frames.
stkh_req__time__hw_clock_sync.title: Synchronize the HW clock with Vehicle Time

stkh_req__time__monotonic_clock_api.content:
The SW-platform shall provide access to the current monotonic clock from the system time provider.

Note: to which clock the monotonic clock is mapped, depends on the system design.
stkh_req__time__monotonic_clock_api.rationale: Enables an application to get the current system time, which is essential for time-sensitive operations and event scheduling, via common, mockable and standardized API.
stkh_req__time__monotonic_clock_api.title: Local Monotonic Clock API

stkh_req__time__vehicle_time_api.content: The SW-platform shall provide access to synchronized vehicle time.
stkh_req__time__vehicle_time_api.rationale: Enables an application to correlate its data with a vehicle-internal time reference for event timestamp and chronological events comparison.
stkh_req__time__vehicle_time_api.title: Vehicle Time base API

stkh_req__time__vehicle_time_sync.content:
The SW-platform shall provide a time synchronization framework to synchronize its clock
to Time Master within the vehicle.
stkh_req__time__vehicle_time_sync.rationale: Enables the system to compare events chronologically.
stkh_req__time__vehicle_time_sync.title: Vehicle Time base Synchronization
